A mysterious being who exists on the edge
of dreams and reality. Fond of offering advice
and intent on providing guidance. Appears in
Fire Emblem Warriors: Three Hopes.

Mythic Effect: Anima
Boost: HP+5, Res+5

Grants allies this Mythic Effect during Anima
season, if the Anima blessing has been conferred
and if this unit enters battle in Aether Raids with
them: Anima-blessed allies decrease the
Aetheric Lift lost for defense failures during
Anima season. (This decrease is limited to the
number of Mythic Heroes (Max: 2) × the number
of Heroes with the blessing conferred × 5.)

During Anima season, this Mythic Hero will
decrease Aetheric Lift loss for defense
failures depending on number of merges. (This
decrease is limited to the number of times the
units have been merged × 1 (Max: 20).)

Mythic Effect 2: Anima
Boost: Defensive Team Bonus
(Details can be found in Edit Defensive Team.)

Advantage over all but colorless foes!
Supports teammates by delaying foe
Specials across a wide area.

$aAccelerates Special trigger (cooldown count-1).
At start of turn, inflicts【Guard】on foes
within 3 rows or 3 columns centered on unit
with Res < unit's Res. If unit initiates combat
or is within 2 spaces of an ally, grants
Atk/Spd/Def/Res+5 to unit during combat,
deals damage = 20% of unit's Res (including
when dealing damage with a Special triggered
before combat), and foe cannot make a
follow-up attack.

【Guard】
Inflicts Special cooldown charge -1 on target
per attack during combat through its next action.
(Only highest value applied. Does not stack.)

Grants Atk/Res+9. Grants weapon-triangle
advantage against and inflicts weapon-triangle
disadvantage on red, blue, and green foes
during combat. Neutralizes effects that
boost values along with weapon-triangle
advantage or reduce values along with
weapon-triangle disadvantage (Triangle Adept)
on unit and foe. At start of combat, if unit's
HP ≥ 25%, unit makes a guaranteed follow-up
attack during combat.

At start of turn, if unit is within 2 spaces of
an ally, grants Atk/Res+6 and the following
status to unit for 1 turn: "Unit can move to
a space adjacent to any ally within 2 spaces."
If unit is within 2 spaces of an ally, grants
Atk/Res+3 to unit during combat.

In the future witnessed by Lucina,
Chrom's daughter, Chrom was slain
by a traitor's hand, allowing the Fell
Dragon to be resurrected. The world
was plunged into despair. To save
both her father and the future, Lucina
traveled through time and prepared
her blade for battle, convinced
Validar would manipulate Robin into
killing Chrom...

A despicable scheme was hatched by
the tyrannical king of Plegia, which
was neighbor to Ylisse. The result
was the death of the exalt of Ylisse,
Chrom's elder sister. Plunged into
despair, Chrom's spirits were raised
by Robin, whose tactical prowess
aided in the downfall of Plegia's king
and the restoration of Ylisse. Chrom
and Robin grew close, sharing a bond
as if two halves of a whole...

It was then that the Empire of Valm
crossed the seas and descended
upon Ylisse. With few options left to
him, Chrom sought the aid of Plegia's
newly crowned king, Validar. But in
his court they met his hierophant...
who bore an uncanny likeness to
Robin. That night, Validar appeared
in Robin's mind and delivered the
shocking revelation that he was, in
truth, Robin's long-lost father...

At sea, the fleets of Valm and Ylisse
were matched ship-for-ship, but Valm
had twice the number of troops at
its disposal. Robin's genius, however,
gave Ylisse the upper hand. Emptying
half of their ships and loading them
with oil, Ylisse sent their fleet into
Valm's, incinerating their foes in a
daring surprise attack. Once ashore
in Valm, Chrom and company joined
the resistance against the Empire...

The Voice of the Divine Dragon, the
symbol and might of the resistance,
remained locked away within the
Mila Tree under the careful watch
of the Empire. When Chrom and
his fellows rescued the Voice, she
delivered a chilling prophecy of the
Fell Dragon's return. To prevent
catastrophe, they must collect the
five gemstones of the Fire Emblem
and perform the Awakening rite...

After a long struggle, the Valmese
Empire was quelled and Chrom then
turned to Plegia, who held the final
gemstone. Upon arrival, it became
clear the trials were not over—Validar
used his power to force Robin to
wrest the Fire Emblem from Chrom.
Chrom's daughter Lucina, armed with
knowledge of the future, realized that
Robin was her father's killer, and so
steeled herself to slay a beloved ally.
